title: Introduction to Machine Learning
body:
Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that focuses on building systems that learn from data. Key concepts include:

- Supervised learning: training with labeled data
- Unsupervised learning: finding patterns in unlabeled data
- Reinforcement learning: learning through trial and error

Common algorithms include decision trees, neural networks, and support vector machines.

TODO: Review gradient descent algorithm

title: Project Planning: KnowledgeFlow App
body:
Goals for the KnowledgeFlow application:

1. Semantic search and linking between notes
2. Automatic task extraction from content
3. Daily digest generation

Phase 1: Core functionality (database, CRUD operations)
Phase 2: Semantic features (TF-IDF, link building)
Phase 3: UI polish and testing

Target launch: Q2 2024

title: Recipe: Homemade Pizza Dough
body:
Ingredients:
- 3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 packet active dry yeast
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 cup warm water

Instructions:
1. Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit 5 minutes
2. Mix flour and salt in large bowl
3. Add yeast mixture and olive oil
4. Knead for 10 minutes until smooth
5. Let rise 1 hour until doubled
6. Punch down and shape as desired

Perfect for Friday pizza nights!

title: Book Notes: Atomic Habits
body:
Key takeaways from 'Atomic Habits' by James Clear:

**The Four Laws of Behavior Change:**
1. Make it obvious (cue)
2. Make it attractive (craving)
3. Make it easy (response)
4. Make it satisfying (reward)

**Important concepts:**
- Focus on systems, not goals
- Habits are the compound interest of self-improvement
- Environment design is crucial
- Identity-based habits are most sustainable

"You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems."

- [ ] Implement habit stacking technique
- [ ] Design better environment for writing

title: TypeScript Best Practices
body:
Essential TypeScript patterns for better code:

**Type Safety:**
- Always define explicit return types for functions
- Use interfaces for object shapes
- Leverage union types for flexible APIs
- Avoid 'any' - use 'unknown' instead

**Code Organization:**
- Separate types into dedicated files
- Use barrel exports (index.ts)
- Prefer type composition over inheritance

**Common Patterns:**
```typescript
// Discriminated unions
type Result<T> = { success: true; data: T } | { success: false; error: string };

// Utility types
type Partial<T> = { [P in keyof T]?: T[P] };
```

Remember: TypeScript is about making invalid states unrepresentable.

title: Gardening Tips for Spring
body:
Spring gardening checklist:

**Preparation:**
- Test soil pH and amend as needed
- Clear winter debris
- Prune dead branches
- Apply compost to beds

**Planting Schedule:**
- Early spring: peas, lettuce, spinach
- Mid spring: tomatoes, peppers (after last frost)
- Late spring: beans, cucumbers, squash

**Maintenance:**
- Water deeply but infrequently
- Mulch to retain moisture
- Watch for pests (aphids, slugs)

Remember: "The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now."

- [ ] Order heirloom tomato seeds
- [ ] Build raised bed for herbs

title: Database Design Principles
body:
Core principles for effective database design:

**Normalization:**
- 1NF: Eliminate repeating groups
- 2NF: Remove partial dependencies
- 3NF: Remove transitive dependencies
- BCNF: Boyce-Codd normal form

But remember: denormalization is sometimes necessary for performance!

**Indexing Strategy:**
- Index foreign keys
- Index frequently queried columns
- Avoid over-indexing (write performance cost)
- Consider covering indexes for complex queries

**Schema Evolution:**
- Use migrations for version control
- Never delete columns directly (deprecate first)
- Add columns as nullable initially
- Test migration rollback paths

**Performance Tips:**
- Use connection pooling
- Implement proper caching
- Monitor slow query logs
- Regular VACUUM/ANALYZE (PostgreSQL)

Related concepts: ACID properties, CAP theorem, eventual consistency
